data.title: Eisenhower Health Graduate Medical Education (GME)
data.meta_description: Overview Information For Applicants Faculty Current Residents Graduate Placement Chief Residents PGY-3 PGY-2 PGY-1
data.text:
Shahram Aghaei, MD

HOMETOWN: Fresno CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: CSU Fresno

MEDICAL SCHOOL: St. George’s University

ABOUT ME: I was born and raised in Tehran. I moved to Brunei after high school by myself and lived there for a few years until I moved to Fresno, California where I met my beautiful wife. Having lived on my own for so long, I have developed a passion for cooking. I love sharing a delicious meal with friends and family. Besides cooking, my other hobbies are learning about various tech and software, following stock market trends, and investing. I learned to play the guitar when I was 14, and I have some very nice electric guitars that I have been ignoring for a while now. I want to get back to playing the guitar more regularly.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT:

Zoha Ahmed, MD

HOMETOWN: Khobar, KSA and Hershey, PA

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland – Bahrain

ABOUT ME: Of Pakistani descent, I was born and raised in the States before moving to the Middle East. The global milieu enabled me to embrace the cultural, social, and economic diversity encountered in healthcare. It also taught me to connect with people and value their stories, often reflected in my practice as a physician. Outside of medicine, I enjoy spending time with friends and family, trying out new recipes, and taking on Pinterest projects.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduating medical school with highest honors.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? I was drawn to the culture that permeates the Internal Medicine residency program at Eisenhower. The program fosters a culture of patient-centeredness, mentorship, camaraderie, and growth.

Sofia Aljilani, MD

HOMETOWN: Anaheim Hills, CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Chapman University

MEDICAL SCHOOL: American University of the Caribbean

ABOUT ME: I’m a California girl, through and through, but I love traveling and trying different cuisines. My favorite place that I’ve visited so far has been Sevilla, Spain. In my free time I like exploring different areas, but the beach is my preferred chill spot. You can also catch me at Orangetheory fitness, cooking something new, listening to music, watching animal docs or diligently shopping online. Oh, and I absolutely adore my chubby orange cat, CousCous! 🙂

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduating from medical school and matching into residency

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? As a California native, I knew I wanted to match close to home and specifically SoCal. I also wanted to work in a non-toxic environment. On my interview day, I loved how engaging the staff were and the abundance of resources offered at Eisenhower. Resident wellness was also a priority for me and I appreciate how Eisenhower takes care of residents to the best of their abilities.

Dana Awad, MD

HOMETOWN: Damascus

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Damascus University/ Faculty of Medicine

ABOUT ME: I was born and raised in Damascus in a lovely neighborhood. A few years before the match, I moved with my family to California. I like spending time with family. I believe love is the spirit of life. I enjoy singing, cooking, and doing activities in nature.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: I matched in my favorite program!!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? When I was a medical student, I rotated in Eisenhower Health. I noticed the family atmosphere and the diversity of clinical experience that the program offers. In addition, the hospital is located in a lovely and beautiful city in Southern California. It was obvious how all the staff were happy to be in this place!

Mary Ayad, MD

HOMETOWN: Cairo, Egypt

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Ain Shams University, Faculty of Medicine, Egypt

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: As a post doctoral research fellow, I Joined the Texas Center Healthcare Quality innovation multidisciplinary team; focusing on improving patient quality and safety.

I lead several QI projects targeting sepsis, venous thromboembolism, and ICU mobility. Worked on identifying areas of potential improvement, developed new algorithms, and data visualization dashboards.

Presented several oral and poster presentations nationally at The American College of Chest Physicians(CHEST), American Thoracic Society (ATS) and the Institute for Healthcare Improvement(IHI).

Won the first place award at our annual internal medicine QI fair for our project “”Code Sepsis for Surviving Sepsis”” targeting improving outcomes in sepsis patients.

I also served as a Co-Investigator for around 25 industry, NIH, and DoD-funded clinical trials. The majority of the clinical trials were studying investigational COVID-19 therapies.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? The program’s commitment to providing high-quality healthcare to patients aligns with my passion for quality improvement to deliver the highest health care value to our patients. Training at Eisenhower is an excellent opportunity to learn from an array of qualified physicians with diverse expertise and backgrounds.

Brittany Barba, MD

HOMETOWN: Davis, CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: UC Davis

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Ross University

ABOUT ME: I’m a resident physician with extensive experience prior to beginning my career in medicine at the age of 30. Before medical school, I worked in a number of health care, academic and non-profit settings including the UCLA Division of Geriatrics, UC Davis Health, and St. Barnabas Senior Services. My unique background broadened my perspective, but also focused my interests. I look forward to a career in internal medicine with an emphasis in geriatrics. While not studying or in the hospital, I enjoy walking in nature and visiting local coffee shops.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: In 2014, I earned a Master of Public Health in community health sciences from UCLA. This experience advanced my knowledge and skills in community-based programming and research. In 2020, I led a research study analyzing the impact of the COVID-19 California stay at home order on the psychosocial wellbeing of diverse older adults. Results were presented at the American Geriatrics Society 2021 Annual Scientific Meeting.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? The Eisenhower residency program offers an excellent training environment with supportive faculty, diverse patient population and access to latest medical technologies. Also, I appreciate the year-long sunshine!

Carlos Morales Chinchillas, MD

HOMETOWN: Mexicali, Mexico

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Universidad Autonoma de Baja California

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Universidad Autonoma de Baja California

ABOUT ME: I was born in Southern California and raised in Mexico. I feel fortunate and grateful for the education I had growing up that showed me that if I had a dream I will be able to reach it. I am passionate about teaching and learning. I enjoy spending time with family and friends, especially outdoors.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Made great friends during medical school. Top 2% of the national licensing exam.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? During the interview I was convinced Eisenhower was the place for me. Residents and staff were friendly, down to earth, and easy-going. And I couldn’t say enough about the beauty of Eisenhower’s campus.

Leo Estrada, MD

HOMETOWN: Fontana, CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Claremont Colleges

MEDICAL SCHOOL: University of California, Riverside

ABOUT ME: I was born in Fontana, CA and raised traveling between the Inland Empire and Mexicali, Mexico. As a first-generation college student and the first physician in my family, I was raised in a home that emphasized hard work and caring for others as an act of love and service. I was fortunate enough to find mentors early in my undergraduate career that shaped these core values while serving the community through a career in the medical field. Outside of medicine, I like to travel and pick up new creative hobbies constantly, including drawing, painting, and cosplaying. I also love board games and am continuously searching for new games.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Spending a summer on the cliffs of Northern California studying Pacific seabirds to aid in forest conservation efforts with the Federal Bureau of Land Management. Geocaching soil samples for analysis of organic matter composition analysis of soil type conversion.

Performing behavioral and sound experiments on mouse models of Fragile X syndrome with IHC labeling of hippocampal neurons.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? Having grown up traveling to and from Northern Mexico, I had an interest in training at a facility that served the communities of the Coachella Valley and Inland Empire. Eisenhower Health was uniquely situated to care for exactly that population and I am grateful for the caring physicians and staff that I saw striving to improve the lives of their patients while I rotated through Eisenhower as a medical student.

Hydee Abaya Ghazaleh, MD

HOMETOWN: Orange County, California

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: University of California, Berkeley

MEDICAL SCHOOL: St. George’s University

ABOUT ME: I was originally born in the Philippines, and I lived there for a while before moving to California as a teenager. I love food, fitness and my cat. The thing I most enjoy is spending time with friends and family doing just about anything — from playing board games to having potlucks, watching movies, hiking or cooking!

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Completing medical school with high honors.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? There was a strong sense of warmth, friendliness and support among residents and faculty at Eisenhower Medical Center. I knew that this was a great learning environment, and I wanted to be a part of it.

Jonathan Ghazaleh, MD

HOMETOWN: Anaheim, California

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: UC Berkeley

MEDICAL SCHOOL: St. George’s University

ABOUT ME: I enjoy spending time with my friends and family as well as meeting new people! I’m just getting back into golf, I like playing video games and board games, and I really enjoy weight lifting and eating healthy. My medical interest is Cardiology, and I hope to complete a Cardiology fellowship in the future.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduated medical school Magna Cum Laude as part of the Iota Epsilon Alpha honors society.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? I decided to attend Eisenhower Health because everyone was very friendly during the interview process. I felt like the culture was very healthy and one I can really fit in with. I also really loved the Rancho Mirage area and am excited to live here for the next 3 years! Finally, Eisenhower has had a successful track record with fellowship matching, which is something I want to do.

Shamila Habibi, MD

HOMETOWN: Shiraz, Iran

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Fasa University of Medical Sciences

ABOUT ME: I grew up in Iran, in a family that loves to travel and visit new places, explore different cultures and try different cuisines. I think I grew the most not in school, but in the summers that I was traveling with my family. I enjoy swimming, camping and solving puzzles – if I was not a physician, I would have worked in the Ikea assembly service or as a beach lifeguard.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: I got an opportunity to work with a prestigious Immunology research team at Harvard Medical School. We worked on a cohort project aiming to uncover human’s antibody responses to SARS-CoV-2 and COVID-19 vaccine development.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? Every resident I met and interacted with before and during the interview was satisfied and happy.

Anthony Lim, MD

HOMETOWN: San Ramon, CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: University of Melbourne, Australia

MEDICAL SCHOOL: University of Melbourne, Australia

ABOUT ME:

– Probably moved around too much: Born in Palo Alto, raised in San Jose, Pleasanton, San Ramon, Mountain View, Danville. Then Melbourne in Australia for 7-ish years. And now back in California!

– My passions in life: food, photography, exploring nature, gardening, playing the piano, keeping up with technology/privacy, and catching up with my shows, anime, and manga.

– Medical specialty interest: Cardiology (electrophysiology or interventional heart failure).

– Fun fact about me: Frederic Chopin is my favorite piano composer, and I love playing a full range of his works, especially Fantaisie-Impromptu Op.66, Waltz Op. 64 No. 2, and Nocturne Op. 9 No. 2.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT:

– Research! A case report on myocardial calcification after sepsis in the European Heart Journal, and work/abstracts in cardiac imaging/heart failure (Cardiac Society of Australia and New Zealand). And interestingly, some papers on musculoskeletal biochem and intervention with the International Journal of Tryptophan Research, and Gerontology.

– Teaching! I really enjoyed mentoring my 2 students, watching them treat their patients well and with compassion, and seeing them go on to publish research and present at conferences.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? More like, why not? Since interview day, there was this strong vibe of support among colleagues and from the faculty. Plus, being near good food, amazing scenery, all in a friendly community/regional setting – yes! Even a physician (light years away in Australia) speaks highly of the area: “Well, you’ll be in an area that’s close to like-minded people who prioritize a good lifestyle.” All this for 3 years? Sign me up!

Paloma Serrano Lopez, MD

HOMETOWN: Calexico, CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Centro De Estudios Universitarios Xochicalco, Escuela de Medicina, Ensenada, B.C

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Centre de Estudios Universitarios Xochicalco, Ensenada, Mexico

ABOUT ME: I was born in Mexico and raised in California. If I were to describe myself, I would say I am a dreamer, hard worker, an enthusiast, and a positive energy seeker. I love to exercise and travel to meet new people. On my free time, I like to visit coffee shops. Back in Mexico I was a Medical Professor, where I taught over 300 medical students helping them achieve their highest dreams through education and inspiration.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduated medical school with honors from Centro de Estudios Universitarios Xochicalco, Escuela de Medicina, Ensenada B.C.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? During the interview, the staff was easy-going, friendly, and welcoming. I had previously visited the facility and was impressed by the design of the architecture and its beauty, but more than anything, by the opportunities Eisenhower Health offers the physicians as well as the high quality standard of patient care.

Su Wai Moe, MD

HOMETOWN: Yangon, Myanmar

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Basic Education High School No.2 Latha, Yangon, Myanmar

MEDICAL SCHOOL: University of Medicine 1, Yangon, Myanmar

ABOUT ME: I pursued medicine out of a desire to save lives and help people through medicine. I practiced as a physician in my hometown and then in Jamaica, WI before my American dream come true. I am an easy-going and ambitious person. I love traveling because it allows me to explore different cultures and people as well as nature. I also enjoy watching movies.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT:

– Matching with Eisenhower Health

– Burmese American Medical Association (BAMA) Academic Achievement Award 2020

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? I found out that the program is not only IMG friendly but also diverse and didactic. So, I am eager to be part of a team with friendly colleagues, staff, and outstanding attending physicians. I also love the warm weather of Southern California.

Kyaw Moe Naing, MD

HOMETOWN: Yangon, Myanmar

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Basic Education High School No (2), Bahan, Yangon, Myanmar

MEDICAL SCHOOL: University of Medicine 1, Yangon, Myanmar

ABOUT ME: I left my hometown after graduation hoping to get the opportunity for advanced medical training someday. I then had been practicing as a physician and serving the underserved community in Jamaica, WI until my American dream come true. As much as I am passionate about medicine, I also love different cultures and diversity. I enjoy playing soccer and basketball with friends. My favorite teams are Manchester United and Golden State Warriors. I also love cooking during my free time.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT:

– Matching with Eisenhower Health

– Burmese American Medical Association (BAMA) Outstanding Academic Achievement Award 2020

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? The program is didactic and well organized with a flexible schedule. During the interview, I felt like I am warmly welcomed as the program director, associated program directors, attending physicians, colleagues and staff are very friendly and supportive. I also love living in Southern California where the weather is nice and warm throughout the year.

Noor Al-Ameri, MD

HOMETOWN: Baghdad / Iraq

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Al-Mutamaizat high school

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Baghdad University/ College of Medicine

ABOUT ME: I’m a foodie person, explorer of different cuisines, trying my best to come up with new recipes, travel enthusiast, beach and sun lover. My family is my life.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Matching with my first rank choice at Eisenhower Health!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? Since my first day I sensed the family atmosphere. The residents are thoughtful, innovative and passionate about their work, and the dedicated and talented faculty provide exceptional support and mentorship. Internal Medicine is always a growing field and Eisenhower Health is at the forefront of this specialty. I know that I will receive exceptional, unparalleled training, and I am honored to be a part of the Eisenhower family! I am looking forward to living in beautiful Palm Springs, which besides its close proximity to both L.A. and San Diego, this city offers a lot of wonderful activities that I am excited to partake with my amazing co-residents!

Julia Oberndorf, MD

HOMETOWN: Laguna Beach, CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: California State University, San Bernardino

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Ross University

ABOUT ME: I was born and raised in Saigon, Vietnam. My family moved to Laguna Beach, CA when I turned 16 so my siblings and I could finish high school and attend university in the U.S. During my free time, I enjoy going to Target and Costco for the vibes. One fun fact about me is that I could eat hot soup even if it’s 130 degrees outside! I love hanging out with my family and friends, completing escape rooms, watching 90 day Fiancé, online shopping and decorating my house!

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: During medical school, I had to move to 4 different states and a whole new country. As if that wasn’t hard enough, 2 out of 4 years of my medical school journey took place during the pandemic but I was determined to graduate with high honors – and I did!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? During undergrad, I had the opportunity to shadow a couple of physicians at Eisenhower and immediately knew this is where I belong. The passionate care, positive attitude and knowledge they possess instilled in me the desire to attend residency at Eisenhower so I could learn how to be a well-rounded physician just as they are.”

Bashar Oudah, MD

HOMETOWN: Baghdad / Iraq

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Al-Mutamaizeen High School

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Baghdad University/ College of Medicine

ABOUT ME: Practically in love with all the outdoors, but mostly kayaking, hiking, camping, barbecuing, and long road trips.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Matching with Eisenhower Health

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? I am incredibly excited to have matched at Eisenhower Health because the program already feels like my second family. Everyone, from my fellow residents to the faculty and ancillary staff, creates a friendly environment where we can learn as young physicians and focus our efforts on taking care of the patient and still have a well-balanced life style. Besides that, living in Palm Desert has a lot to offer from new coffee shops and restaurants to easily accessible outdoor activities which makes more excited about the next chapter of my life.

Akash Patel, MD

HOMETOWN: Ahmedabad, India

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Smt. N.H.L. Municipal Medical College, India

ABOUT ME: “In the Happiness of others, lies our own” That’s what paved my path to be a better physician. I was born and raised in India, and I came to the U.S. to live with my fiancé. I had the opportunity to learn medicine from the ground while working in rural Tennessee as a PCP. Other than medicine, I really enjoy watching Bollywood movies and cricket. Also, I read a lot of business and self-help books.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? I have heard only good things about Eisenhower from locals. It actually felt like a good fit for me and I had awesome vibes on interview day.

Niket Patel, MD

HOMETOWN: Ahmedabad, St. Louis, Los Angeles

MEDICAL SCHOOL: AMC MET Medical College

ABOUT ME: I was born and brought up in India and also attended my medical school in India. United States being one of the pinnacle in the healthcare system, I came here for a few rotations which made me decide to pursue medicine here. Apart from medicine, I am an avid sports fan and can find me watching and playing any sport from cricket to tennis, football, table tennis…you name it! I love going outdoors and hanging out with friends. I am a foodie too and recently have been trying my hand in the kitchen to get into the groove of residency and cook a few good dishes.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Attended a lot of underserved and the less privileged part of the society and got to know about the disparity in healthcare between different sections of the society. Tried my best to help my patients and I wish to continue it in my future journey with that same passion.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? I was part of the unusual virtual interview season but still everyone, including the faculty, program coordinators and the residents, were very warm and receptive on the interview day. Apart from that, the perks that the program provides and the wonderful location in California, I couldn’t ask for more.

Roham Salman Roghani, MD

HOMETOWN: Yazd, Iran

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Tehran University of Medical Sciences, School of Medicine

ABOUT ME: I was born and raised in Iran and I moved to United States in 2018.I am feeling blessed about my carrier and I enjoy every single day at work. Beside medicine, I love exploring the nature, playing tennis and collecting antiques.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: I have been always interested in gastrointestinal disease and I have started doing research in this field since my medical school. After my immigration to USA, I did postdoc fellowship in colon cancer at Duke University which was an amazing experience and make me even more motivated to peruse my carrier in GI field.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? Having outstanding and supportive attending with a friendly environment at work, which can make every challenge, a memorable thing during residency.

Andrew Salama, MD

HOMETOWN: Torrance, CA

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: University of California, Riverside

MEDICAL SCHOOL: American University of the Caribbean

ABOUT ME: Proud to have been born and raised in Southern California. I love being around my family and friends. I enjoy the beach and playing basketball in my free time. Huge Kobe Bryant fan. I am passionate about medicine and providing top care for our community.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduating medical school and matching at my dream program in my home state of California!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? Other than living in one of the most beautiful cities in California, Eisenhower Health is a beautiful, well-distingushed hospital that I know will provide me the training to be an exceptional physician. The Eisenhower family creates an environment of cameraderie, enthusiasm, and compassion that I know provides the best care for the patients!

Shiva Salmasi, MD

HOMETOWN: Tabriz, Los Angeles

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Tabriz University of Medical Sciences, Iran

ABOUT ME: I have practiced as a medical doctor and clinical researcher for several years. The more time I devote to clinical work and medical research, the more interest and enthusiasm I find in myself in the field of medicine. I am an outgoing person and enjoy dancing, hiking, and traveling and exploring different places and cultures.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Participated in several clinical research projects at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center. Matched with my first rank residency choice at Eisenhower Medical Center.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? It is absolutely a great place to be trained and become a competent internist. I am impressed by the supportive and friendly atmosphere within the program. And the location, I love Southern California, and here in Coachella Valley, you can enjoy the warm weather and sunshine throughout the year!

Mariam Seliman, MD

HOMETOWN: Sohag and Palm Desert Egypt and CA United States

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Sohag University Faculty of Medicine, Egypt

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Sohag University Faculty of Medicine, Egypt

ABOUT ME: I am a blessed wife of an outstanding physician and mother of three gorgeous kids who continuously provide me with tremendous support.

I love learning about different cultures and beliefs. My passion is getting to know people as I believe they are similar to chapter books waiting to be read. I am interested in reading through their pages and providing medical and emotional help. This passion is the leading motivation for me to practice medicine.

I also enjoy reading, listening to different styles of music, swimming, and cooking dishes from various cuisines.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduating from medical school in Egypt and obtaining certifications in clinical documentation improvement and medical coding.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? Eisenhower is an institution that delivers medical education in a high-tech yet friendly environment. I was impressed by the outstanding attendings, faculty, and excellent diverse residents.

Anthony Silvestre, MD

HOMETOWN: Houston, TX

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: University of Texas at Dallas

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Ross University

ABOUT ME: I was born and raised in Houston, TX and enjoyed traveling and making amazing memories with my parents before going to college and, eventually, medical school. Outside of medicine, I love playing and listening to music (jazz in particular). I also like staying active, trying new foods, and hanging out with my two cats.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduating from medical school and matching at Eisenhower Health

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? During my day interviewing at Eisenhower Health, I immediately got the impression that the faculty cares for the well-being of their residents as much as they care for providing outstanding, world-class patient care. Furthermore, the residents whom I interacted with during the breakout sessions were very happy and fulfilled to be learning at Eisenhower Health.

Abram Soliman, MD

HOMETOWN: Los Angeles

MEDICAL SCHOOL: School of Medicine at Assiut University, Egypt

ABOUT ME: “I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music” -Albert Einstein, physicist/violinist. Being a professional violinist at the cultural palace of Egypt was a delightful honor, but it didn’t keep me from pursuing the ultimate joy of practicing the art of medicine. I’ve lived in Los Angeles, Egypt, Turkey, Italy and Chicago. I love exploring controversial ideas and theology on planet Earth! Believe me when I say that having Turkish coffee after shish kebab creates wonders!

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: It’s a bumpy journey that started with getting a free medical education leading to matching at Eisenhower Health; and it’s not the end yet!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? It’s not only an excellent teaching hospital with a unique history, but it’s a diverse family where you feel that you belong. It provides the right settings to build excellent future physicians and creates an environment that ensures a happy yet well-balanced experience. The area is sunny and relaxing with a lot of fun spots to check out.

Muhammad Tayyab Tahir, MD

HOMETOWN: New York, NY

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Shifa College of Medicine, Pakistan

ABOUT ME: Having lived in different countries during my years of education, I had the privilege of experiencing interesting cultures, communities, and health care systems. I particularly loved my work in the community caring for underserved populations. In my free time, I enjoy a peaceful jog, a cup of strong java, and visits to areas of historical significance. My interests lie primarily in serving as an internist/primary care provider for my local community.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: My care of patients in the poorer communities of Pakistan gave me a humbling perspective on how much inequality exists in the provision of care; it made me realize just how blessed my colleagues and I were, in regards to the facilities, medications, and other amenities afforded to us

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? The friendliness among residents, the warm faculty, the supportive environment, and most importantly, the honor of being able to work and care for a local community.

Qais Zawaydeh, MD

HOMETOWN: Ajloun, Jordan

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Misr University for Science & Technology

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Misr University for Science & Technology

ABOUT ME: I come from a culturally diverse background. I was born in Jordan, raised in Saudi Arabia, studied medicine in Egypt, and finally joined my family in the U.S. This experience shaped my enthusiastic personality and made it possible to easily adapt to different aspects of life. Outside of medicine, I enjoy playing soccer, playing the guitar, hiking, swimming, traveling, and cooking (I might be the best fettuccine alfredo chef in town!).

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Contributing in COVID related research and publishing papers while applying for residency.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH? During my interview it was very evident that the community at Eisenhower is a diverse one. From the patient population, to international residents and doctors, to the friendly environment, it was all tremendously inspiring. I was also intrigued by the advanced technology implemented at the hospital. Palm Springs with 300 sunny days a year weather was also an added bonus!

Tongwa B. Aka, MD

RESIDENCY PROGRAM: Internal Medicine

HOMETOWN: Buea Southwest Region Cameroon

UNDERGRADUATE: Oakland University

MEDICAL SCHOOL: St. George’s University School of Medicine

ABOUT ME: I was born and raised in Buea, Cameroon, and moved to the United States with my family. After undergrad, I worked as a Clinical Research Associate for two years in the Department of Structural Heart Cardiology where my love for cardiology started. Some of my core values are diversity and mental wellness in medicine. Outside of medicine, I enjoy cooking, journaling, traveling and I have sort of an obsession with self-help books and podcasts.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: First, I have been published in the Journal of the Americal College of Cardiology. I aspire to be a Cardiologist, so this gives me a headstart in the specialty I love. Secondly, leadership was also a big part of my academic journey, being part of the executive board of the student government at SGU and for our region of the Student National Medical Association (SNMA). Lastly, my top academic highlight must be matching into my #1 residency program.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: During the interview season, I was looking for a program where I would have the perfect balance of supervised autonomy. It was also crucial for me to feel mentally supported by my program. I found all of these in Eisenhower Health. The staff was very friendly, and the relationship between the residents and faculty felt very organic and made me the most comfortable.

Laura Castillon, MD

RESIDENCY PROGRAM: Internal Medicine

HOMETOWN: Truckee, CA United States

UNDERGRADUATE: University of Nevada, Reno

MEDICAL SCHOOL: American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine

ABOUT ME: I feel very fortunate to be able to return to my home state for residency and I could not be more thrilled to start my career as a physician at Eisenhower. My passion for medicine comes from my mom. Her fascination with medicine and her many careers within the medical field inspired my journey from an early age. Prior to medical school, I worked in hospitals as well as on an ambulance for a number of years. Outside of medicine, I love to lap swim and I also love to sing. In my free time you’ll find me exploring new places in California (like Huell Howser in California’s Gold). A favorite recent experience was visiting an alpaca farm in Santa Barbara!

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Studying medicine in the beautiful country of Saint Maarten!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: It was clear to me after my visit to Eisenhower, I was where I was meant to be. I felt part of the team while attending morning report and hospital rounds. I was filled with excitement to learn from the physicians I met in my interview and in-person. I had the immediate impression the residents were extremely knowledgable and I knew I was going to get a great education. Since moving here, I’ve met some incredible people. I am honored to serve such a wonderful community!

Paul Formaker, DO

RESIDENCY PROGRAM: Internal Medicine

HOMETOWN: Forestville, CA United States

UNDERGRADUATE: University of California, Berkeley

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Touro University California

ABOUT ME: I grew up in Northern California, Sonoma County and have called California home my entire life, including attending UC Berkeley for my undergraduate degree. I took a longer road to medical school, first working as an EMT, then as a Clinical Research Coordinator at a top cancer center in the nation, and managing a non-profit for a rare genetic disorder before deciding to pursue a career as a physician. I’m an avid sports fan (Go Warriors!) and enjoy “managing my fake teams” as my wife calls it, for both the football and basketball fantasy seasons (and anything else I can sneak in). I’ve loved getting to travel the world with my wife, but now look forward to the lively days at home with our daughter. In whatever spare time I can find I usually opt for a video game or a book, hopefully enjoyed with a good beer. When the weather is amenable, I also enjoy teeing it up with close friends on a picturesque golf course.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: I was focused and dedicated during my time in medical school, earning myself a Sigma Sigma Phi Honor Society membership, but one of my favorite memories during medical school was working with our mobile diabetes education program to develop and record training videos for other students. My wife, a nurse, and I were able to record these videos that are now being used so that incoming medical students are able to quickly train and then help patients in an underserved community learn about and manage their diabetes – hopefully leaving a lasting impact.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: I promised my wife (a Los Angeles native) I would at least consider moving back down to Southern California for Residency, and after my interview with Eisenhower Health I realized how fortunate I would be to complete my residency training here. Their state-of-the-art facilities and commitment to the community will help me to grow professionally and personally as a physician during my time here. The 100+ golf courses didn’t hurt either.

My favorite adventure so far has been pursuing a career in medicine.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Being inducted into the Gold Humanism Honor Society during my transitional year of residency.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: I was blown away on interview day by how friendly and personable the attendings were at Eisenhower! It also doesn’t hurt to have world class golf across the street.

Although after two clinical observerships in cardiology my interest in this field started to bloom, I am going to discover my real field of interest in IM in the next 3 years.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: Eisenhower was one of my best observership experiences, gave me a real sense of being an Internal Medicine resident in the future and I realized how much I am excited to join such a great and professional team. I loved my experience at Eisenhower. Here everybody treats you as a family! and you will be prepared not only as a very competent physician but also as a kind and caring person for humans.

After almost losing my thumb and having spent a week as a patient in the hospital, the trajectory of my life shifted dramatically. I had been preparing to take over my family’s construction business. I reflect on my accident now and know it was the catalyst that prompted me to change careers and dedicate myself to medicine. Apart from medicine, I love to cook, travel, read, watch movies, and discover arts and culture.

Graduating from medical school, I was excited to be matched into my top-choice program at Eisenhower Medical Center, which I consider a significant achievement.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: During my interview, I was impressed with the commitment of the faculty and staff to provide a supportive and friendly learning environment. Also, I enjoyed the camaraderie among the residents which was evident during my time spent with them. Furthermore, the Eisenhower Medical Center is a beautiful facility close to home in Palm Springs. Being a Coachella Valley resident, staying close to home enables me to help and learn about my community.

My interest in medicine began early when I was in elementary school and would tag along with my parents to their doctor appointments. Later it grew while majoring in human biology in college and volunteering at a local cancer infusion center. Outside of medicine, I love to spend time with my family and friends, exercise, watch basketball (huge Lakers fan), try new restaurants, attend concerts, and travel/explore the beauty of California!

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: My academic highlights are getting the opportunity to present orally at the Western Medical Research Conference for research I did on autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease, as well as graduating with honors in medical school.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: I have many reasons for choosing Eisenhower Health. The first being how engaging and thoughtful my conversations with faculty were on my interview day. With just that initial interaction, I knew Eisenhower would be able to offer a supportive atmosphere conducive to both personal and professional growth. Its location is in close proximity to family and friends and offers a great amount of entertainment/activities that I enjoy. Finally, the hospital’s successful track record of fellowship matches aligned perfectly with my career aspirations of becoming a hematologist/oncologist.

Sylvia Lee, MD

HOMETOWN: New York, NY United States

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: University of California, Berkeley

MEDICAL SCHOOL: University of Queensland, Australia

ABOUT ME: Born in New York, raised in California, lived in Sierra Leone and Australia.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: While working for UNICEF Sierra Leone during the West African Ebola epidemic, I helped publish “The effect of community-based prevention and care on ebola transmission in Sierra Leone.”

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: Eisenhower Medical Center was my top choice for residency for multiple reasons. I was impressed by the program’s excellent teaching and research opportunities. It is unsurprising that Eisenhower won the Leap Frog award in 2023 for best teaching hospital. I am excited about the mobile health clinics and all the community service opportunities that Eisenhower encourages. I believe my experiences at Eisenhower will nurture clinical excellence, cultural sensitivity, and personal growth in compassion and kindness.

Eduardo Padilla, MD

HOMETOWN: San Diego, CA United States

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: University of California, San Diego

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Centro de Estudios Universitarios Xochicalco, Campus Tijuana

ABOUT ME: I was born in San Diego, California (a border city with Tijuana, Mexico). I’ve had the privilege of calling both sides of the border, my home for a significant portion of my life. My bi-cultural upbringing has profoundly influenced my worldview and identity and molded me into who I am today. Outside of medicine, I enjoy spending time with family and friends, hiking new trails, going to the gym, and some friendly competition over board games and video games.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Graduating as valedictorian from medical school and receiving the 2022 AMFEM-Pfizer award for academic excellence. I am also very happy to have matched at my first-choice residency program, Eisenhower Health.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: During interview season, Eisenhower Health stood out to me as the perfect fit. Despite the virtual format of the interview, the warmth and camaraderie among everyone involved made it a memorable experience. A second look at the campus only solidified my initial impressions, revealing a strong sense of support among faculty and residents, a conducive learning environment, an amazing campus, and the bonus of being close to home.

Meshwa Patel, MD

HOMETOWN: Ahmedabad, India

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: N/A

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Smt. B. K. Shah Medical Institute & Research Center

ABOUT ME: I was born and raised in Ahmedabad, India, and relocated to the United States in 2022 after completing medical school. One of my fondest childhood memories is traveling across various parts of India with my family. Growing up in a household where both my parents are physicians, particularly helping women in our community, sparked my interest in medicine early on. Internal Medicine captivates me due to its broad range of acute and chronic conditions, as well as its collaborative approach involving multidisciplinary teams. I am passionate about medicine’s transformative and healing capabilities. Besides medicine, I enjoy outdoor activities like hiking and playing various sports. You might find me sometimes sitting in a corner doodling or reading books.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Engaging in and actively contributing to different research projects and publications both during and after medical school, and securing a spot as an IM resident at Eisenhower Health.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: I have consistently heard positive feedback about Eisenhower from the local residents during my stay in the area. This positive impression deepened when I completed my observership at Eisenhower. In addition to offering excellent academic rotations, the hospital also fosters a very welcoming work environment that made me feel like I was part of a close-knit family. The stunning view from the hospital was an added bonus.

Victor Samperio, MD

HOMETOWN: Mexicali, Baja California, Mexico

UNDERGRADUATE SCHOOL: Universidad Autonoma de Baja California

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Universidad Autonoma de Baja California

ABOUT ME: I was born, raised, and trained in Mexico but after completing a series of clinical rotations in Houston, TX, I started working there as a clinical research coordinator of early phase hematology/oncology trials. A few years later, I became the research director for a research site in El Centro, CA, and an associate professor of medical genetics at my alma mater. Outside of medicine, I’m a husband and a dad (dad jokes in development) who enjoys mariachi music, hikes, and having movie marathons with his family.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: During my time in medical school, I was a tutor for the microbiology department and a member of the student council. After graduation, I had the amazing opportunity of collaborating in the development of three programs for International Medical Graduates (IMGs).

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: It all started with great feedback from local physicians, but by the end of my interview it was decided, I needed to become part of this program. The faculty, program coordinator and residents seamlessly provided a fun, reassuring and informative experience during my interview day and second-look day. In addition, their state-of-the art facilities and commitment to their community only made my decision easier. I’m certain Eisenhower Medical Center will help me become the well-rounded physician I aspire to become.

MEDICAL SCHOOL: Sackler School of Medicine

My passion for medicine began while volunteering at a free medical clinic, where I felt deep gratification and a passion for patient care. I am honored and excited to train as an internal medicine resident.

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: Matching into Eisenhower Health!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: Serving and learning from physicians caring for the Southern California community I call home is a true honor. During my sub-internship at Eisenhower Health, I was genuinely impressed by the program’s dedication to clinical training. I also experienced firsthand the commitment to excellent and compassionate patient care. It is a privilege to train at Eisenhower Health!

I am happy that I am pursuing my childhood dream, and I am grateful for having opportunities to touch people’s hearts every day. Along with medicine, I have a deep passion for reading, writing, and nature. I also enjoy spending time with my loved ones. I thrive on new experiences and adventures, and I am always eager to explore and learn new things. I believe that this curiosity and openness to get out of my comfort zone enable me to continually develop as a person and a physician.

Contributed a chapter in the book “Cancer Genetics and Psychotherapy”

Exemplary Student Certificates in various rotations

Member of the National Elite Foundation

Research Fellow at the Department of Cardiovascular Disease at Mayo Clinic

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: Eisenhower Health is a fantastic place for personal and professional development. I was truly impressed by how friendly and positive everyone was during my visit. The program cares about the well-being of its residents and works hard to create a supportive and educational environment. The staff and faculty make sure that residents have everything they need to grow as medical professionals. Eisenhower Health is dedicated to building a culture of excellence, teamwork, and compassion, which makes it a perfect place for people who want to become successful physicians.

Outside of medicine, I love working out, cherishing moments with my friends and family, and embracing the joy of hosting gatherings. I am always down to party and have a good time.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: I fell in love with the Eisenhower community during the interview process. I enjoyed talking with the attending and residents which solidified my decision to choose Eisenhower. I have a huge passion for traveling (been to over 30 countries so far!) and hope to continue to grow that list any chance I can get. I love trying new things and will always be up for any new adventure. In my free time, you’ll most likely find me watching something Marvel, Disney, or Star Wars and hanging out with my friends and family (including my 2 dogs and cat).

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHT: During my clinical rotations, I saw a need for patient educational resources that was tailored for the population that one of my hospitals served. I worked with multiple attendings and hospital administrative staff to create 2 specific patient educational resources regarding the managements of Warfarin use and Asthma treatments that are still being utilized today.

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: I had the opportunity to do an elective rotation and attend the second-look at Eisenhower, and immediately felt the family-like atmosphere among all the residents and faculty. This, along with the large emphasis on education, well-being, and patient care I knew that Eisenhower Health was the perfect place for me. Also, I could not be happier coming back home to Southern California!

WHY EISENHOWER HEALTH: After my interview, I was immediately drawn to this program. The strong sense of community among residents and faculty resonated with me. The warmth and closeness among everyone there—residents, faculty, and staff—assured me that this was the perfect environment for my growth as a physician. Plus, being close to home and its great location was a bonus!
